17.text:
Welcome to Dragons Lair Update. This month
Howard Community College lacrosse competes

22.text:
for glory in the playoffs. Men’s Lacrosse
marches into the Region Tournament, Coach

27.text:
Carey’s Dragons look to make history, and
we'll recap Track and Field Nationals with

32.text:
Head Coach Errick Henlon. Men’s Lacrosse
leads off. Howard’s postseason journey begins

38.text:
where last year’s ended. The Dragons battle
Anne Arundel in the Region 20 Semifinal. Mike

47.text:
Thanks Diane. Our analyst coached at Howard
for eleven years. In his playing days he helped

51.text:
Towson State reach the national championship
in '91, and the national quarter finals in

55.text: '92. It's a pleasure to welcome Mike Jones.

56.text:
Mike it's great to be here, thanks for having
me back.

59.text:
The winner advances to the Region 20 Championship,
the loser season is over. A win for Howard

64.text:
will likely result in the program’s second
trip to Nationals, via At-large selection

68.text:
or the region’s automatic bid. With losses
to Howard and Suffolk, Anne Arundel needs

72.text:
to win the Region 20 Championship to make
it to Nationals. The Howard-Anne Arundel rivalry

77.text:
has been evenly matched. They’ve split their
last eight meetings dating back to 2010. Anne

82.text:
Arundel ended Howard’s season in last year’s
Region Semifinal. Howard is 4 days removed

86.text:
from a blowout loss to Essex. Entering that
game the Dragons were undefeated in the region,

91.text:
Coach, how can Howard bounce back against
Anne Arundel?

94.text:
If the Dragons can repeat their performance
from earlier in the season against Anne Arundel,

98.text:
scoring 11 goals, they should be okay. It
will be a little more difficult without Austin

102.text:
Mitchell, who is out with an injury he suffered
against Essex. Somebody like Geron Brooks

106.text:
is gonna have to step up. Possession at the
face-off x, good ball control, and running

110.text:
their team offense will be key for them today.
Defensively, holding Anne Arundel to 6 goals

113.text:
in the first game was a great effort, they’re
gonna need to do something similar today.

118.text:
Anne Arundel knocked out CSM in the first
round to secure a rematch with Howard. If

122.text:
recent history is any indication, Anne Arundel’s
regular season loss to Howard is a positive.

126.text:
You have to go back to 2008 to find the last
time Howard or Anne Arundel beat each other

130.text:
twice in the same season. Adding to the intrigue,
leading scorer Darek Davis did not play in

135.text:
the loss to Howard. Coach, what do you expect
to see from Anne Arundel?

140.text:
Possession will be key for Anne Arundel as
well. Howard has a lot of offensive weapons

143.text:
and the more Anne Arundel can hang onto the
ball and put pressure on goalkeeper, Andrew

147.text:
Sileo, and the defense, the better off they’ll
be. Traditionally Anne Arundel’s defense

151.text:
has been their strength, they’ve had good
individual defensemen that can control their

155.text:
attackman. With the size of the Riley brothers,
and the athleticism of Cody Martin, they’re

158.text:
gonna need to step up today to slow down the
Dragons’ offense.

161.text:

to Riley! Broken up by Robertson. And it's

Riley got pushed there, bad call, the official

Nine in blue, Neal, with the ball in his stick

gets underneath, and he scores. Anne Arundel

612.text:
Good defense by Reyes, but Neal's just able

616.text:
Coach, what are your final thoughts on this
one?

619.text:
HCC got away from their quick ball movement
to the backside offense. Even though they

623.text:
scored 11 goals, most of them were on individual

628.text: Dragons, but it just wasn’t enough.

629.text: Anne Arundel advnaces to the Region 20 Championship.

633.text:
It’s time for Women’s Lacrosse. Our analyst
played varsity lacrosse at Wilde Lake High

637.text:
School. While there she was one of their top
scorers and an Elite 300 camp alum, it's a

644.text:
Coach Carey’s Dragons are one win away from
history. A win against Nassau secures the

649.text:
program’s first trip to Nationals, and keeps
alive hope for their first Region 20/Distrct

653.text:
BD Title. Howard is coming off of a heartbreaking
loss to Harford that cost them the outright

658.text:
Maryland JUCO regular season championship,
and the number one seed in the tournament,

663.text:
setting up a tough semifinal test against
Nassau. MaryLee, what do you expect to see

668.text:
Well, coming into this game they’re very
evenly matched, they both have some go-to

671.text:
players that they’ll need to keep an eye
on. Howard has Erica Heaphy, she’s going

675.text:
to be the one on offense to really make things
happen and drive Howard offensively. Howard

680.text:
is also going to be counting on Charlotte
Wilkinson to really control the draws and

684.text:
get things started for the offense. Howard’s
Defense is going to have a tough time controlling

688.text:
Nassau’s speed. They are very quick and
don’t give defenders much time to create

692.text:
strategies. Howard needs to play smart and
set things up behind the goal, really find

696.text:
a way to work the ball around the crease and
find those open lanes. They have the skills

699.text:
and the experience to come out of this on
top but Nassau isn’t going down without

705.text:
The Lions enter the Tournament on a two game
losing skid. Nassau is 4-5 overall, their

709.text:
last game was a 10 goal loss to Howard. This
season Nassau gave Harford a close game, Nassau

714.text:
beat Suffolk by a small margin early in the
season, and you could argue Nassau played

718.text:
a tougher schedule. MaryLee, describe the
Lions’ game.

721.text:
Well Nassau is a very aggressive team. They
use their speed offensively to tire out defenses

726.text:
and their big scorer is Kerri Baum, she is
going to be the one setting up the plays or

730.text:
just driving it straight to goal. She’s
very quick and can out-run defenders so Howard

734.text:
really needs to play tight to her and make
sure they are double covering when she’s

738.text:
near the goal. Nassau is also very scrappy
they can be a little dirty and will not be

743.text:
holding back so Howard is going to have to
use their stick skills and play calling to

747.text:
out smart Nassau. I think ultimately it’s
going to come down to who wants it more and

751.text:
who can finish. There’s a national spot
on the line so both teams are going to be

755.text:
giving it all they have. This is it for one
of them.

758.text:
Howard takes on Nassau in a win or go home

1283.text:
The Lions put an end to Howard's season, Nassau
advances to the Region 20, District BD Final,

1288.text: and moves on to Nationals. 13-12 is your final.

1292.text:
My first guest has posted a winning regular
season record in each of her four seasons

1296.text:
at Howard, a program first for HCC Women’s

1302.text:
high school and club lacrosse in Howard and

1307.text: Head Coach Diana Carey. Welcome coach.

1311.text:
Let's talk about the Nassau game in the Region
20 first round. How did you think your team

1317.text:
It was a really tough game. Um, you know I
don't know what it was but the girls were

1323.text:
not all there, which is unfortunate because
you can't come into playoffs unless you're

1328.text:
mentally you know, ready to go and physically
ready to go. We've you know, had a lot of

1333.text:
injuries all year long which has been tough,
but Nassau was definitely ready to play this

1337.text: game and I just didn't feel like we were.

1340.text:
You are known as one of the funniest coaches
on the sideline.

1346.text:
You don't probably know this, but our staff
would watch your antics um, you're pretty

1352.text:
funny. So what I'd like to do is, some of
the funniest quotes I'm gonna' just throw

1358.text:
out at you and I want you to kind of tell
me what these quotes mean.

1363.text:
They're- what circumstances. Alright, first
quote: Say you're sorry!

1368.text:
Well I just say that because it's... a little
bit for my players to realize that if they're

1374.text:
being rough they're not supposed to be rough,
and I don't want them to be so "say you're

1380.text:
sorry" is my way of saying you know, knock
it off without saying "knock it off." The

1384.text:
ref's usually laugh at it too and the other
team does also, so it's just adding a little

1388.text:
levity to a situation that maybe could get
a little tense.

1391.text: Why do we not know how to run a play?

1394.text:
Because we don't. <laughter> I'm not quite
sure why, but um, we'll go over things over

1400.text:
and over and over again, but yet we get on
the field to play it and I don't know what

1403.text:
happens but, they lose their left, their right.
They just, I don't know, they don't run it.

1408.text:
So I do lose my mind a little bit on that
one.

1411.text:
Okay, there's a field out there, I hope you
find it.

1414.text:
Well, we all have a tendency to crowd, we
like to crowd inside the middle, crowd inside

1419.text:
the eight, and I don't really understand why
because there is a big field, and the more

1424.text:
we use it offensively the harder it is for
our- for their defense to try to cover us.

1430.text:
That concept didn't really get through. I
kept pushing it, but sometimes I'd pull people

1435.text:
all the way over to the side and come talk
to me so that I could let them know, look

1440.text:
at the size of the field here, why are we
all inside the 12? But uh, yeah, there is

1446.text:
So now that you won't be coaching here at
HCC, what are you going to spend your time

1450.text:
Well, I'm gonna' actually be concentrating
a little bit more on the official end of things.

1454.text:
I've become the laccrosse chair for um, my
board which is Maryland Select Officials Association.

1458.text:
So um, I'm going to try to focus more on that,
focus more on training use officials, and

1466.text:
trianing officials in general. And I also
will be continuing on with club laccrosse,

1472.text: and I'm getting a new puppy.

1474.text:
Wow, Coach Carey I want to congratulate you
on a terrific um, years of coaching here at

1480.text:
Howard. Um, you'll go down as history's one
of our most favorite coaches.

1486.text:
Uh, for the sport. You really built the sport
up to where it is today, and hopefully it's

1490.text:
going to be in good hands for somebody else,
and I know you'll still be back in some capacity.

1498.text:
Up next, we’ll break down the Track and
Field National Championships with Head Coach

1507.text:
Learning at home. Learning in the classroom.
Learning for success. For learning that works

1522.text:
for you choose Howard Community College. To
find courses and programs that fit your schedule

1527.text:
and learning style visit HCClearningworks.com.
You can get there from here!

1534.text:
It’s time for Track and Field, my next guest
brought home Howard Community College's first

1539.text:
National Championship in 2013. Head Coach
Errick Henlon joins me now, welcome Coach.

1547.text:
Coach, this was your first year as a head
coach, now of the program. Tell me what you

1556.text:
Well, competing at the national is, it's a
very challenging, very challenging event and

1565.text:
in order to be successful you really have
to plan really well, in order to do well.

1571.text:
So we tried our best this year to nail our
plan down to the T from when we left here,

1581.text:
from all our traveling, down to what we do
in the morning, what we do in the afternoon.

1587.text:
So it's just a matter of planning our schedule
and sticking to it, and it worked out pretty

1592.text:
well for us, and we went there with a very
disciplined team, and I'm proud of the kids

1600.text:
Let's talk about Ashley. Now Ashley Doucoff
repeated as our national champion the 400

1606.text:
meters. So what was her reaction when she
won?

1609.text:
She was, she was overjoyed. I um, I was having
a little bit more, I would love to see her

1617.text:
going 56, but she broke her record she set
last year so that's still good. You can't

1624.text:
really, you can't really second guess her
for that, and in the 200 this year she ran

1630.text:
a great race. She followed the instruction
that was laid out and she ran, she ran her

1636.text:
heart out for that race. She just lost it
by a few steps. So I'm really proud of her,

1642.text:
she did- she did much better this year than
she did last year.

1645.text:
Gary Smalley won the steeple chase, first
time in the history, right? Of an athlete.

1652.text: Yes, that we are winning that steeple chase.

1655.text:
Man, he was overjoyed. As Coach- Coach Mussleman
said, he fell on the ground and when Steve

1664.text:
went up to him he said "did I win?" He was
overjoyed. He ran a great race, I mean it

1672.text: was fantastic to see his performance.

1675.text:
So, reflecting back on your first year as
a head coach now, what are you going to take

1683.text:
Look, last year, as I pointed out, last year
we made some fundamental mistakes, right.

1691.text:
We really, we got caught up in the moment
of winning. As I pointed out, winning is not

1700.text:
everything in life. It's only when you prepare
to win, and we forgot about the basic things

1707.text:
that we need, we used to do to allow us to
do very well. So um, this year we retool and

1715.text:
we went back to the drawing board, and we're
sticking to the basic things that we needed

1721.text:
to do, and I'm satisfied, I'm pleased with
the result that we got this year.

1726.text:
Great season coach, and we'll do it again
next year.

1729.text:
Thank you very much Diane. Thanks for having
me.
